title: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: Classic Roman pasta dish with eggs, Pecorino Romano cheese, cured pork (guanciale), and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Creamy, mildly spiced curry dish featuring marinated grilled chicken chunks (tikka) in a rich tomato-based sauce.

title: Caesar Salad
description: Green salad of romaine lettuce and croutons dressed with lemon juice, olive oil, egg, Worcestershire sauce, anchovies, garlic, Dijon mustard, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper.

title: Margherita Pizza
description: Traditional Neapolitan pizza made with San Marzano tomatoes, fresh mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, salt, and extra-virgin olive oil.

title: Beef Bourguignon
description: French stew prepared with beef braised in red wine, often flavored with carrots, onions, garlic, and a bouquet garni, and garnished with pearl onions, mushrooms, and bacon.

title: Pad Thai
description: Stir-fried rice noodle dish commonly served as street food in Thailand, typically made with rice noodles, shrimp or chicken, tofu, peanuts, scrambled egg, and bean sprouts.

title: Chocolate Lava Cake
description: Individual chocolate cake with a molten chocolate center, often served warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

title: Sushi Platter
description: Assortment of Japanese cuisine consisting of cooked vinegared rice combined with other ingredients, usually seafood, vegetables, and occasionally tropical fruits.

title: Classic Cheeseburger
description: A hamburger topped with cheese, typically served on a sliced bun with condiments like lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, mustard, mayonnaise, or ketchup.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
description: Quickly cooked mix of fresh vegetables like broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, and snow peas stir-fried in a wok or frying pan with soy sauce and ginger.

title: Miso Soup
description: Traditional Japanese soup consisting of a stock called 'dashi' into which softened miso paste is mixed. Tofu and seaweed are common additions.

title: Fish and Chips
description: Popular British takeaway food consisting of deep-fried battered fish served with deep-fried potato slices (chips).

title: Tacos al Pastor
description: Mexican dish of spit-grilled pork, marinated in a blend of chilies and spices, served on small corn tortillas with pineapple, onions, and cilantro.

title: French Onion Soup
description: Hearty soup made with beef broth and caramelized onions, typically served gratinéed with croutons and cheese on top.

title: Hummus with Pita Bread
description: Middle Eastern dip made from cooked, mashed chickpeas blended with tahini, lemon juice, and garlic, served with warm pita bread.

title: Chicken Wings (Buffalo Style)
description: Deep-fried chicken wing sections generally served unbreaded, coated in a vinegar-based cayenne pepper hot sauce and melted butter.

title: Peking Duck
description: Famous duck dish from Beijing that has been prepared since the imperial era. The meat is characterized by its thin, crisp skin.

title: Greek Salad (Horiatiki)
description: Salad made with tomatoes, cucumbers, onion, feta cheese, and olives, typically seasoned with salt and oregano and dressed with olive oil.

title: Falafel Wrap
description: Deep-fried balls or patties made from ground chickpeas or fava beans, served in a pita or flatbread wrap with salad and tahini sauce.

title: Ramen Noodle Soup
description: Japanese noodle soup, with a combination of a rich flavored broth, one of a variety of noodles and a selection of meats or vegetables, often topped with a boiled egg.

title: Lasagna Bolognese
description: Italian baked dish made with wide flat pasta layered with ragù (meat sauce), béchamel sauce, and cheese.

title: Pho Bo (Beef Noodle Soup)
description: Vietnamese soup consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat (usually beef), popular street food.

title: Apple Pie
description: Fruit pie in which the principal filling ingredient is apples, often served with whipped cream, ice cream ('apple pie à la mode'), or cheddar cheese.

title: Gyoza (Japanese Dumplings)
description: Pan-fried Japanese dumplings, typically filled with ground meat and vegetables and wrapped in a thin dough.

title: Chicken Parmesan
description: Breaded chicken breast covered in tomato sauce and mozzarella, Parmesan, or provolone cheese.

title: Shepherd's Pie
description: Meat pie with a crust or topping of mashed potato, traditionally made with minced lamb.

title: Clam Chowder (New England Style)
description: Cream-based chowder containing clams, potatoes, onions, and sometimes salt pork or bacon.

title: Shrimp Scampi
description: Italian-American dish of shrimp sautéed in garlic, butter, white wine, and lemon juice, often served over pasta.

title: Bibimbap
description: Korean rice dish topped with assorted seasoned vegetables, gochujang (chili pepper paste), a fried egg, and sliced meat (usually beef).

title: Caprese Salad
description: Simple Italian salad, made of sliced fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and sweet basil, seasoned with salt and olive oil.

title: Beef Wellington
description: Fillet steak coated with pâté and duxelles (finely chopped mushrooms), wrapped in puff pastry, then baked.

title: Croissant
description: Buttery, flaky, viennoiserie pastry of Austrian origin, named for its historical crescent shape.

title: Ceviche
description: South American dish of fresh raw fish cured in fresh citrus juices, most commonly lime or lemon, and spiced with ají, chili peppers or other seasonings.

title: Tom Yum Soup
description: Hot and sour Thai soup, usually cooked with shrimp (Tom Yum Goong), lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, lime juice, fish sauce, and crushed chili peppers.

title: Paella Valenciana
description: Spanish rice dish originally from Valencia, typically made with rice, saffron, chicken, rabbit, green beans, butter beans, and snails.

title: Eggs Benedict
description: American breakfast dish consisting of two halves of an English muffin topped with Canadian bacon, a poached egg, and hollandaise sauce.

title: Biryani (Chicken or Lamb)
description: South Asian mixed rice dish made with spices, rice, and meat (chicken, lamb) or vegetables.

title: Ratatouille
description: French Provençal stewed vegetable dish, originating in Nice, primarily consisting of tomatoes, zucchini, eggplant, bell peppers, and onion.

title: Tiramisu
description: Coffee-flavoured Italian dessert made of ladyfingers dipped in coffee, layered with a whipped mixture of eggs, sugar, and mascarpone cheese, flavoured with cocoa.

title: Chili Con Carne
description: Spicy stew containing chili peppers, meat (usually beef), tomatoes, and often kidney beans or pinto beans.

title: Kimchi Jjigae
description: Spicy Korean stew made with kimchi, tofu, pork or seafood, and vegetables.

title: Samosa
description: Fried or baked pastry with a savoury filling, such as spiced potatoes, onions, peas, or minced meat, popular in South Asia.

title: Moules Frites
description: Belgian dish of mussels cooked typically with white wine and onions, served with French fries.

title: Jambalaya
description: Louisiana Creole dish of Spanish and French influence, consisting mainly of meat and vegetables mixed with rice.

title: Baklava
description: Rich, sweet dessert pastry made of layers of filo filled with chopped nuts and sweetened and held together with syrup or honey.

title: Cornbread
description: Quick bread made with cornmeal, associated with the cuisine of the Southern United States.

title: Gazpacho
description: Cold Spanish soup made of raw, blended vegetables, typically tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, onions, and garlic.

title: Bruschetta
description: Italian antipasto consisting of grilled bread rubbed with garlic and topped with olive oil, salt and pepper. Variations include toppings of tomato, vegetables, beans, cured meat, or cheese.

title: Chicken Caesar Wrap
description: A wrap sandwich containing the ingredients of a Caesar salad: romaine lettuce, grilled chicken, croutons, Parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing.

title: Pulled Pork Sandwich
description: Sandwich made with slow-cooked pork shoulder shredded ('pulled') and mixed with barbecue sauce, served on a bun.
